node.doctext:
Purpose

Writeup Bonus is an alternative level bonus system to the [Honor Roll].

It awards writeup bonus points for the following criteria:

  • One point for every 3rd, 4th, and 5th C! on an author's writeups.
  • One point for achieving a reputation of 26 on a writeup.
  • One point for achieving a reputation of 52 on a writeup.
  • One point for achieving a reputation of 78 or more on a writeup.

Thus, a writeup can earn a max of 6 writeup bonus points. The total of these writeup bonus points is then added to the user's actual number of writeups, and compared to the level writeup requirements for placement purposes.

Primary Nodes

  • [User Settings] node (user can turn on Writeup Bonus / Honor Roll, shows difference between two - also runs calculateBonus for first time users)

Secondary Nodes

  • [vote] opcode (contains call to calculateBonus)
  • [cool] opcode (contains call to calculateBonus)
  • [shownewexp] htmlcode (displays writeups left based on Writeup Bonus)

Perl Modules

  • Everything::Experience::calculateBonus (makes SQL calls and does math to determine writeupbonus)
  • Everything::Experience::getLevel (if Writeup Bonus On, uses calculateBonus to determine level)

User Interface Model

  • A user must have "Use Writeup Bonus Instead of Honor Roll" turned on. (VARS->settings_useWriteupBonus must return true.)
  • If a voter votes on or cools a writeup by the user:
    • A call is made to Everything::Experience::calculateBonus, which will adjust a user's bonus accordingly.
    • The user's writeup bonus total is stored as VARS->writeupbonus.
      • Thus, it is also possible for admins to award writeup bonus points arbitrarily (something akin to [superbless] or [bestow cools]) for being a good member of the E2 community. This allows us to level members up faster if it is deemed worthwhile.

Known Issues

  • Reputation step is hardcoded into calculateBonus.
  • No superdoc available to adjust writeupbonus arbitrarily.
